Material used.Description: αSyn variants were produced by site - directed mutagenesis using AccuPrime pfx from Invitrogen. The expression and purification of recombinant wild type and mutant αSyn were as previously described. Solutions containing αSyn were dialyzed against ammonium bicarbonate before lyophilization and the freeze - dried αSyn stored at - 20 °C for fluorescence studies. Protein was dissolved in Phosphate Buffer Saline (PBS) buffer (pH 7.4, NaCl 137 mM), filtered through a 100 kDa filter by centrifuging at 4 °C to remove big aggregates and the final protein concentration was around 140 μM with 20 μM ThT for fluorescence measurements.

Readout description.Conclusion: A53T substitution dominates the growth kinetics
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Speeds up the fibril assembly kinetics
Readout description.Result Description: Five - fold differences in apparent growth rates were observed for the eight variants. The A53T substitution is the dominant factor in modulating the growth rates. Variants with human A53 residue at the N - terminal have slower growth rates, while those with mouse T53 residue have faster growth rates.

Readout description.Conclusion: A53T and S87N substitutions have a synergistic effect on the lag time
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Affects the length of the lag phase
Readout description.Result Description: The average lag time varied from 8 to 110 hours. The simultaneous A53T and S87N substitutions have a synergistic effect on the lag time and do not act independently of one another.

Biological replicates.Description: At least six replicates were performed on each variant

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Averaged lag times and growth rates were calculated as well as the corresponding standard deviations. A factorial analysis was performed to analyze the effect of A53T and S87N on the lag time.

Material used.Description: The fibrils were grown in the well plates during the ThT kinetic experiments. One droplet of the sample from the well plate was placed on a discharged carbon - coated 300 - mesh grid and then stained with freshly prepared 1% (w/v) uranyl acetate.

Readout description.Result Description: All the variants were found to form amyloid fibrils within 8 days. The fibril widths are around 10 nm and lengths vary from around 20 nm to 2 μm. The fibrils are always helically twisted or stuck together, and for HMM, HHH and HHM long single fibrils prevail.
Same as for A53T, all variants form amyloid fibrils with similar morphological characteristics.

Material used.Description: All NMR experiments were carried out using approximately 400 μM 15N labeled and 13C labeled αSyn in 10% (v/v) D2O in PBS buffer (same conditions as the kinetic studies) at 15 °C.

Readout description.Conclusion: There are local differences in secondary structure propensities at position 53
Readout description.Result Description: SSP scores along the sequence are quite similar to one another except for the region around position 53. For the group that has A53, the SSP scores are negative suggesting more β - sheet conformations. For the group that contains a Thr at position 53, the SSP values are more positive suggesting more local helical conformation.

Biological replicates.Description: Duplicate triple resonance spectra collected on different machines several months apart

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The 13Cα and 13Cβ chemical shifts have a standard deviation of 0.07 ppm
